title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 801.40 - Providing records to government representatives
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 801.40 - Providing records to government representatives

State Regulations
(a) When an authorized government
representative asks for the records the employer keeps under Part 801 of this

Title, the employer must provide copies of the records within four business
hours, regardless of where the records are maintained. The government
representative authorized to receive the records is a representative of the

Commissioner of Labor of the State of New York, conducting an inspection or
investigation under State Labor Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
801.40

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
